articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Special Envoy Leaves for China
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Special Envoy Leaves for China
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army (KPA) Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and director of the KPA General Political Bureau, left here on Wednesday by special plane to visit the People's Republic of China as a special envoy of Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.
					 He was accompanied by KPA Col. Gen. Ri Yong Gil, Kim Song Nam, vice department director of the WPK Central Committee, Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, KPA Lieut. Gen. Kim Su Gil and other officials concerned.
					
					 The special envoy and his party were seen off at the airport by Kim Kyok Sik, chief of the KPA General Staff, Kim Yong Il, secretary of the WPK Central Committee, KPA Col. Gen. Son Chol Ju, Ri Yong Chol, vice department director of the WPK Central Committee, Pak Kil Yon, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and other officials concerned and Liu Hongcai, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Special Envoy Arrives in Beijing
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Special Envoy Arrives in Beijing
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army (KPA) Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and director of the KPA General Political Bureau, arrived in Beijing on Wednesday by special plane to visit the People's Republic of China as a special envoy of Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.
					 Also arriving were suite members of the special envoy KPA Col. Gen. Ri Yong Gil, Kim Song Nam, vice department director of the WPK Central Committee, Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, KPA Lieut. Gen. Kim Su Gil and other officials concerned.
					
					 They were greeted at the airport by Liu Jieyi, deputy head of the International Liaison Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, and other officials concerned and Ji Jae Ryong, DPRK ambassador to China.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Special Envoy Meets Wang Jiarui
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Special Envoy Meets Wang Jiarui
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army (KPA) Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and director of the KPA General Political Bureau, met and had a friendly talk with Wang Jiarui, vice-chairman of the National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference who is a member of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and head of the International Liaison Department of the CPC Central Committee, at the Diaoyutai State Guesthouse in Beijing Wednesday. Choe Ryong Hae is visiting the People's Republic of China as a special envoy of Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK. 
					 Present there were Deputy Head Liu Jieyi, Assistant to Head Yang Yanyi and other officials of the International Liaison Department of the CPC Central Committee, and DPRK Ambassador to China Ji Jae Ryong,
					
					 Wang Jiarui warmly welcomed Choe Ryong Hae to China as a special envoy of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Both sides exchanged views on matters of further improving the bilateral friendly relations at a new, higher stage.
					
					 The talks proceeded in a cordial atmosphere. 
					
					 After the talk, Wang Jiarui hosted a luncheon for the special envoy and his party.

articles.title: U.S. Accused of Calling DPRK "State of Special Concern"
articles.content:
U.S. Accused of Calling DPRK "State of Special Concern"
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK gave the following answer to a question raised by KCNA Wednesday as regards the U.S. malignantly slandering the DPRK in an "annual report on international religious freedom":
					 The U.S. State Department in the "2012 annual report on international religious freedom" on May 20 slandered the man-centered Korean-style socialist system, re-designating the DPRK as a "state of special concern."
					
					 Finding that the military way did not work on the DPRK, the U.S. has resorted to such a base act of issuing the report to tarnish the image of the DPRK in the world.
					
					 The U.S. has kept introducing preemptive nuclear strike means into the Korean Peninsula, gravely threatening the Korean people's right to existence. Yet, it is urging the DPRK to improve the "human rights situation" and "livelihood", the height of shamelessness.
					
					 As the Pae Jun Ho case showed, the U.S. has abused religion for the political purposes of undermining the DPRK and overthrowing its social system.
					
					 Regarding the DPRK as a thorn in the flesh, the U.S. has persistently pursued a vicious hostile policy toward the DPRK. So, no country will believe what the U.S. says against the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. can not solve any matter by gratuitously antagonizing the DPRK. On the contrary, it will suffer bigger losses politically, diplomatically and strategically.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Greets Iranian FM
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Greets Iranian FM
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a congratulatory message to Iranian Foreign Minister Ali Akbar Salehi on the occasion of the 40th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and the Islamic Republic of Iran.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly relations between the two countries with long history and excellent tradition would grow stronger by the common efforts of both sides.
					
					 It wished the Iranian foreign minister bigger successes in his work for the development of the country's external relations.

articles.title: Mun Kyong Dok Meets Delegation of Vientiane City of Laos
articles.content:
Mun Kyong Dok Meets Delegation of Vientiane City of Laos
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- Mun Kyong Dok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and chief secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK, met and had a talk with the delegation of Vientiane City of Laos led by Soukanh Mahalath, secretary of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party, secretary of the Vientiane City Party Committee and mayor, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday.
					 Soukanh Mahalath said that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries are growing strong under the deep care of respected Choummaly Sayasone and the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 During the visit he witnessed the achievements made by the Korean people in building a thriving nation under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un, he stressed.

articles.title: Staff Members of Iranian Embassy Visit Pyongyang University of Foreign Studies
articles.content:
Staff Members of Iranian Embassy Visit Pyongyang University of Foreign Studies
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- Iranian Ambassador to the DPRK Mansour Chavoshi and staff members of his embassy visited Pyongyang University of Foreign Studies on Wednesday on the occasion of the week of the DPRK-Iran friendship.
					 Being briefed on the fact that a lot of talents have been schooled at the university, the guests looked round the room devoted to the history of the university and lecture room.
					
					 They played sports and amusement games with officials of the DPRK at the Pyongyang Gold Lane on the same day.

articles.title: German Guests Visit Mangyongdae
articles.content:
German Guests Visit Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- Jurgen Klimke, member of the Federal Parliament from the Christian Democratic Union of Germany, and his companion visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 At the old home of the President they looked round historic relics preserved there with much care, being briefed on the immortal revolutionary history of the President who dedicated his all to the liberation of the country and its prosperity and the human cause of independence, and on his family. 
					
					 They also toured the Tower of the Juche Idea, the National Gifts Exhibition House, the People's Open-air Ice Rink and the Pyongyang Folklore Park.

articles.title: Tourists Fascinated by Landscape of Mt. Kumgang
articles.content:
Tourists Fascinated by Scenery of Mt. Kumgang
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- The 1st batch of Rason-Mt. Kumgang international tourists by the ship Royale Star went sightseeing in Mt. Kumgang on Tuesday.
					 The tourists spared no admiration at high and steep cliffs, including Manmulsang (myriad-shaped peaks), rocks of fantastic shapes, thick forests, deep valleys and other scenic spots.
					
					 Albert Kukharyk, vice captain of the ship, told KCNA:
					
					 "The view of Mt. Kumgang is so fascinating.
					
					 It is regretful for me not to see all of its spots for lack of time. Back home, I will tell my family members about the scenery of Mt. Kumgang. 
					
					 I want to continue to work in the tourist ship for a long time, so I will come here again."
					
					 Surianto, a crewman of the ship, said:
					
					 "I have never seen such scenic mountain as Kumgang.
					
					 To my regret, I have no time to see Lagoon Samil and other spots. I will tour all other spots of this mountain if I come here again."
					
					 Choe Pok Sil, a resident in Jilin Province of China, said:
					
					 "It was marvelous to command the view of Mt. Kumgang from the top of Manmulsang. Now I am so excited.
					
					 I once visited Jeju Island in south Korea, but Mt. Kumgang is much more beautiful than the island."
					
					 The tourists left Mt. Kumgang on the same day.

articles.title: Lacquered Vase, Gift to Kim Il Sung from Japanese Figure
articles.content:
Lacquered Vase, Gift to Kim Il Sung from Japanese Figure
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- On display at the International Friendship Exhibition House in the DPRK is a lacquered vase, presented to President Kim Il Sung as a gift by the chief of the Wakayama, Japan, Society for the Study of the Juche Idea.
					 While studying the President's famous works, the chief could grasp the truthfulness, scientific accuracy and great vitality of the Juche idea. With deep reverence for Kim Il Sung as founder of the immortal Juche idea, he worked hard to disseminate the idea among Japanese people.
					
					 The vase was made from a sun tree. This presentation was proposed at the seminar on the Juche idea, organized by the society on the threshold of Kim Il Sung's 80th birthday (April 15, 1992).

articles.title: New Health Goods Popular at Int'l Trade Fair
articles.content:
New Health Goods Popular at Int'l Trade Fair
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- New kinds of health goods, made with processed Jonghyang compound lactobacilli, came under spotlight at the 16th Pyongyang Spring International Trade Fair held some time ago.
					 The products in the forms of powder and fermented drinks help enhance immunity to diseases in human body and accelerate growth. Especially, they generate bio-active substances, promote digestion, reduce cholesterol in blood and soften skin.
					
					 They are also efficacious for acute enteritis, colitis and pancreatitis as well as liver and kidney troubles.
					
					 Taking them regularly will prevent diabetes, cerebral and heart vascular diseases and fatness.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Accuses U.S. of Escalating Tension on Korean Peninsula
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Accuses U.S. of Escalating Tension on Korean Peninsula
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces are more desperately clinging to aggressive military provocation against the DPRK from the outset of this year.
					 They staged unprecedentedly large-scale joint military exercises Key Resolve and Foal Eagle against the DPRK in March and April and shelling drills in the waters off Paekryong and Yonphyong Islands, joint anti-submarine drills in the West Sea of Korea and the joint naval drills in the East and South seas of Korea in May.
					
					 Those drills are an open threat and blackmail against the DPRK and grave military provocations to ignite a fresh war on the peninsula at any cost.
					
					 They are also nuclear war drills aimed to mount a preemptive nuclear attack upon the DPRK, to all intents and purposes.
					
					 Nuclear war hardware unprecedentedly huge in the world war history has been involved in the drills.
					
					 They include B-52s, the nuclear-powered submarine Cheyenne, a Los Angeles-class nuclear-powered submarine, a large Ohio-class nuclear-powered submarine and the nuclear carrier strike force made up of various warships including the super-large carrier Nimitz, an Aegis guided-missile destroyer and a guided-missile cruiser. 
					
					 Huge strategic nuclear forces based in south Korea and its vicinity have been ready for carrying out a preemptive strike, a total war at any moment.
					
					 The danger of a nuclear war has constantly existed on the Korean Peninsula due to the ceaseless war racket of the U.S. aimed at a nuclear preemptive strike at the strategic bases of the DPRK.
					
					 Nevertheless, the U.S. is calling those drills "annual ones for defense" for "deterring a provocation". This is nothing but sophism to conceal the danger of their nuclear war drills and to mislead the public opinion.
					
					 Now the U.S. is beefing up its war hardware in south Korea.
					
					 This year the U.S. is mulling deploying there GBU-28 bombs capable of destroying underground bunkers in the depth of 30 meters, GBU-50 and GBU-54 laser guided-bombs capable of making precision strikes at mobile missile launching pads and a tactical airship assigned to monitor round the clock the territory of the DPRK and the movement of its coastal artillery pieces at an altitude of 10 000 meters.
					
					 Such facts go to clearly prove that the U.S. is the arch criminal who has escalated the tension on the peninsula and provocateur and aggressor who has brought the danger of a war to it.
					
					 The aim sought by the U.S. in its concentration of nuclear forces on the peninsula and its vicinity is to totally dominate the Asia-Pacific region by encroaching upon the sovereignty of its people and their right to existence and stifling it.
					
					 It is not fortuitous that the Chinese paper Liberation Army Daily on May 17 in an article titled "Why is the U.S. adding fuel to the flames?" commented that "the first aim sought by the U.S. is to escalate threat to the DPRK so that the latter takes soft-pedaled behavior, the second is to consolidate its strategy of 'rebalancing the forces in the Asia-Pacific region' and the third is to relieve its allies of their worries by providing them with 'extended deterrence'".
					
					 It is nothing but a foolish daydream for the U.S. to try to bring down the DPRK, a full-fledged nuclear weapons state, by such reckless nuclear threat and blackmail.
					
					 The present situation on the Korean Peninsula again proves before the world that the DPRK was entirely just when it opted to take practical measures to further consolidate its status as a nuclear weapons state and to bolster up the nuclear deterrence both in quality and quantity true to the line of the Workers' Party of Korea on simultaneously pushing forward economic construction and the building of nuclear force.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Unabated Actions against U.S. and Fascism
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Unabated Actions against U.S. and Fascism
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- The Kwangju Popular Uprising was frustrated 33 years ago, but the south Korean people's anti-U.S. and anti-fascist struggle for independence and democracy is going on and actions are getting evermore intensified against the dictatorial rule.  
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a bylined article.
					
					  Actions for achieving independence against the U.S. are rapidly mounting among the south Korean people, who experienced through the tragedy in Kwangju that the U.S. is the cruel man-killer, not "protector" and "benefactor".
					
					 Democracy desired so ardently by the Kwangju uprisers can never come true as long as the U.S. is backing the south Korean military fascist dictatorial forces through its colonial domination. 
					
					 Thanks to the just indomitable struggle waged by the south Korean people, the ill-famed military fascist dictatorial rule met its shameful end and "civilian"-veiled dictator was thrown into the dumping ground of history.
					
					 The present ruling forces of south Korea stemmed from the past dictatorial regime which mercilessly quelled the people's desire for independence, democracy and reunification. 
					
					 The more rampant fascist dictatorship gets, the further the people will become awakened.
					
					 The people's anti-U.S. and anti-fascist struggle will go on in the future, too, to frustrate the moves of the puppet ruling forces to bring the dark clouds of fascism to hang over south Korea, following in the footsteps of the successive fascist dictators.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Flays U.S., Japan for Seeking Closer Alliance
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Flays U.S., Japan for Seeking Closer Alliance
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- The U.S.-Japan alliance is  extremely dangerous military one for aggression as it is aimed to stifle some countries in the Asia-Pacific region by force of arms, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a bylined article.
					 It is ridiculous of the U.S. and Japan to underscore the need for closer alliance under the pretext of "threat" and guarantee of "security," the article says, laying bare the sinister aims sought by Washington and Tokyo through tightened alliance. 
					
					 Washington seeks to establish domination over the region by deterring challenging "dangerous forces" and preventing the emergence of a power by dint of unchallenged military edge, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 However, the equilibrium of forces in the Asia-Pacific region is now turning unfavorable to the U.S. 
					
					 The U.S. is channeling great efforts into tightening the military alliance for aggression with its followers while beefing up its forces to turn the situation favorable to it and expand the sphere of its domination over the region. 
					
					 To this end Washington is attaching importance to Japan.
					
					 Japan, too, is prioritizing the tightening of the alliance with the U.S. in pursuance of its own objective.
					
					 The Japanese militarists remain unchanged in their scenario to realize their old dream of "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere" which they failed to achieve in the past.
					
					 They seek to realize it with the backing of the U.S.
					
					 Closer alliance between Washington and Tokyo constitutes a serious threat to the peace and security of the world including the DPRK, the article says, adding that the prevailing situation requires the people of the DPRK to hold higher the banner of Songun and bolster up war deterrent both in quality and quantity.

articles.title: U.S, S. Korea Accused of Taking Issue with KPA's Regular Military Drills
articles.content:
U.S, S. Korea Accused of Taking Issue with KPA's Regular Military Drills
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the White House urged the DPRK to "honor commitments made before the international community", terming the rocket launches by the Korean People's Army (KPA) a "provocation".
					 The puppet regime of south Korea in a "statement" spoke ill of the DPRK, grumbling about the "provocative act" and urging "responsible behavior."
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday commenting on the facts says: This is a vivid manifestation of a sinister attempt to pass the buck for the present tension on the Korean Peninsula to the DPRK, cover up their provocative nature and intensify their moves to ignite a war against the DPRK.
					
					 It is so ridiculous and impertinent for them to make a big fuss even though they have stoked the danger of nuclear war with their reckless military provocations.
					
					 No one can take the issue with the measures for self-defence taken by the DPRK to defend the country, socialism, peace and security now that the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces' enmity against it has reached the extremity.
					
					 They can never conceal their true colors as criminals who brought about the worst tension on the peninsula by which a nuclear war may break out any moment even though they are vociferating about "provocations" and the like.
					
					 The ulterior purpose sought by warmongers in malignantly slandering the regular military drills of the KPA was to escalate their moves to unleash a war against the north under the pretext of coping with the "provocations from the north."
					
					 The validity of DPRK's nuclear deterrence has been fully proven again. The DPRK will bolster its nuclear deterrence for self-defence true to the line on simultaneously pushing forward economic construction and the nuclear force up-building.

articles.title: Minju Joson Discloses U.S. Aim in Developing Latest Weapons
articles.content:
Minju Joson Discloses U.S. Aim in Developing Latest Weapons
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- The U.S. recently made a test flight of ultra supersonic drone in the Pacific Ocean. It poured hundreds of millions of dollars into the development of the drone for many years. It was reported that the speed of the drone is five times that of sound.
					 Not content with this, the U.S. is mulling increasing its speed to be six times faster than the sound speed. If this is put into practice, the U.S. would acquire the capability of striking any region in the world in a few minutes.
					
					 Minju Joson Wednesday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 All facts point to the U.S. persistent dream of world domination based on military edge by putting the whole world in the striking range.
					
					 This is why the U.S. is working hard to develop latest weapons such as ultra supersonic drone.
					
					 The real aim sought by the U.S. is to quell by force of arms any country standing against its strategy for dominating the world.
					
					 This was proved by its stepped-up development of Bunker Buster.
					
					 Bunker Buster is a new-type special bomb which the U.S. is developing allegedly to destroy Iran's underground nuclear facilities.
					
					 This behavior of the U.S. is a main source of worldwide arms race.
					
					 Threat to global peace and security comes from the U.S. It is impossible to achieve permanent peace and security of the world unless the U.S. gives up its scenario for world domination based on its military edge.
					
					 The U.S. had better stop such an impudent act of mocking at the world through deceptive rhetoric about "peace."

articles.title: Appeal Marks 33rd Anniversary of Kwangju Popular Uprising
articles.content:
Appeal Marks 33rd Anniversary of Kwangju Popular Uprising
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea made public an appeal on May 17 on the occasion of the 33rd anniversary of the Kwangju Popular Uprising.
					 The appeal said that the May 18 Kwangju Popular Resistance marked an occasion that fundamentally changed the perception of the U.S. among south Koreans.
					
					 Saying that the U.S. was none other than a wire-puller of the massacre in Kwangju, the appeal added that it was confirmed by the declassified documents of the U.S.
					
					 However, the U.S. has never made even a single word of apology nor assumed any responsibility. The successive "governments" of south Korea failed to urge it to do so, it charged.
					
					 It said that such humiliating behavior helped the U.S. forces in south Korea persist in their murder, arson and rape, charging that during her trip to the U.S. the chief executive failed to utter a word about an unequal relations with the U.S. On the contrary, she discussed only tightened alliance, purchase of the U.S.-made weapons, FTA and the like.
					
					 Expressing will to put an end to sycophantic and servile stand and realize independence, peace and democracy through the dynamic struggle to wreak the grudge of martyrs in Kwangju, the appeal advanced the following slogans:
					
					 Let us block the war crisis and bring earlier the independent reunification by inheriting the May 18 spirit!
					
					 The U.S. should apologize for the massacre of people in Kwangju!
					
					 The U.S. should resume the DPRK-U.S. dialogue and conclude a peace treaty!
					
					 The chief executive, wrecker of the inter-Korean relations, should make an apology before the people!
					
					 The "government", fully implement the June 15 and October 4 south-north joint declarations!
					
					 The regime should rescind FTA and enforce the policy for protecting peasants!
					
					 Let's terminate the danger of war and defend the people's livelihood and peace by the concerted efforts of forces for progress and reform!

articles.title: Japanese Map Marking Tok Islets as Part of Korea's Territory Discovered
articles.content:
Japanese Map Marking Tok Islets as Part of Korea's Territory Discovered
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- An old map of Japan proving that Tok Islets are part of the inviolable territory of Korea was discovered, according to a south Korean internet newspaper on May 20.
					 The map drawn by famous Japanese geographer Shihei Hayashi in 1785 clearly marks Ullung Island and Tok Islets in the same color. There is even a description beside Tok Islets that they belong to Korea. 
					
					 The map widely known to the world is preserved in the national library in Osaka.
					
					 Ringing out from the south Korean academic circle are voices that the old Japanese map would become another historical document proving Japan's claim that Tok Islets are part of its territory is a far-fetched assertion.

articles.title: S. Korean Police's Unjust Arrest of Young Man Flayed
articles.content:
S. Korean Police's Unjust Arrest of Young Man Flayed
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea on May 19 issued a statement in protest against the unjust suppression of a young man by the puppet police.
					 The statement condemned the Kwanak Police Station for arresting on a groundless charge a young man who staged a protest in front of the house of Won Se Hun, ex-director of the Intelligence Service.
					
					  It is well known that Won was the chief architect of the IS's operation for illegal political interference, the statement said, adding:
					
					 It is quite natural for the young man to demand an arrest and investigation into Won.
					
					 The security authorities' crackdown is an action to save the present "government" from a political crisis by suppressing the activities of the progressive civic bodies.
					
					 The authorities are little short of a dictatorial regime as they react to the activities of the civic and social body demanding a fair investigation into the illegal action with a crackdown.
					
					 The statement urged the police to stop the suppression of the progressive forces and arrest Won.

articles.title: IS Accused of Its Involvement in Suppression of Progressives in S. Korea
articles.content:
IS Accused of Its Involvement in Suppression of Progressives in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- It was disclosed that the puppet Intelligence Service (IS) of south Korea was involved in cracking down upon the forces which called for halving the registration fee during the Lee Myung Bak regime, according to south Korean CBS.
					 This disclosure was made by a paper of the IS.
					
					 The paper worked out by an IS staff member on June 1, 2011 said that the opposition parties and the progressive forces are stirring up people of various circles with the assertion that if the policy for lowering the rich people's taxes is rolled back, it is possible to halve the registration fee, while hyping the story that the "government" is responsible for the increased registration fee.
					
					 The paper contained an opinion that it is necessary to brand active members of the opposition parties as "leftists" and term the demand for halving the registration fee an "assertion of the leftists" and thus push for abusing this for a psychological offensive.
					
					 As far as the registration fee issue is concerned, it was one of the deceptive election commitments made by Lee to seize power.
					
					 The Lee group, however, not only sidestepped this issue but mercilessly cracked down upon the youth and students and the people of other strata who struggled for the settlement of the issue.  It went the lengths of resorting to political suppression of them, labeling them "leftists" and "forces following the north."
					
					 The recent disclosure made it clear that the IS was behind the repressive campaign.
					
					 Even former lawmakers from the ruling party held that the disclosed fact is a crucial matter which can bring the Lee regime to justice, CBS noted, and continued: There is suspicion enough to prove that the IS was watching all anti-Lee forces and it is also skeptical that a similar action was taken against those people opposed to the four large rivers project.
					
					 No matter what rhetoric the Lee group of traitors makes to cover up the truth about all crimes committed by it to suppress the forces opposed to the unpopular policy, they are bound to be brought to light with the lapse of time like a gimlet in the sack is bound to protrude.

articles.title: Japan's Lurch to Right under Fire in S. Korea
articles.content:
Japan's Lurch to Right under Fire in S. Korea 
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- An editorial flaying Japan's lurch to the Right was posted on the Voice of People, an internet newspaper of south Korea, on May 20.
					 The editorial recalled that acts of tampering with history have gone beyond the tolerance limit and  right-wing elements are letting loose a spate of reckless remarks as evidenced by the facts that Japanese politicians are visiting Yasukuni Shrine in an endless stream and the  Japanese prime minister is free to make endless outbursts negating Japan's past history of aggression.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The co-representative of the Japanese Restoration Party, an ultra-right conservative party, blustered that "sexual slavery was necessary under the situation at that time," when referring to the crimes related to the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army on May 13. He visited the commander of the U.S. forces in Okinawa and unhesitatingly uttered that "service members of the U.S. forces might widely use gay quarters of Japan to gratify their sexual desire in a legitimate manner", bringing to light his moral vulgarity. 
					
					 It chided the Japanese prime minister, in particular, for having a photo taken with his thumb turning up on the pilot's seat of a training plane No. 731, the figures reminiscent of an ill-famed bacteriological unit of the Imperial Japanese Army. Such behavior sparked off big uproar among various social circles.
					
					 Recalling that the rulers of Japan could not escape their miserable ends for negating its history of past aggression and seeking the revival of militarism, the editorial accused the present government of Japan of following in their footsteps.
					
					 Its lurch to the Right only precipitates its self-destruction, it warned.

articles.title: Meeting for Solidarity with Korean People Held in Italy
articles.content:
Meeting for Solidarity with Korean People Held in Italy
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- A meeting for solidarity with the Korean people took place in Rome on May 14. 
					 The attendants of the meeting were briefed on the situation on the Korean Peninsula and heard speeches. 
					
					 The secretary of a district committee of Rome Municipality of the Communist Party of Italy said that the U.S. and other imperialist reactionary forces and media of the West were conducting sheer false propaganda about the DPRK. Consequently, not a few people have a wrong understanding of the reality of the DPRK and the cause of the tension on it, he noted, adding:
					
					 We have the pleasure to inform the attendants of the situation on the Korean Peninsula to help them have a correct understanding of the aims sought by the U.S. and its allies, the just measures taken by the DPRK to cope with them and its reality. 
					
					 The secretary general of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea said that it was the height of double standards applied by the U.S. and its allies to claim that the DPRK alone is not allowed to launch satellites. 
					
					 He went on:
					
					 The U.S. recently staged provocative and large-scale war exercises in the vicinity of the Korean Peninsula, pushing the situation to the worst phase. 
					
					 It is natural for the DPRK to react to the U.S. moves to stifle it with the toughest measures. 
					
					 The U.S. can never bring the DPRK to its knees as it is led by the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The chairman of the Italian Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea said that the ceaseless military threat posed by the   U.S. to the DPRK while persistently pursuing hostile policy towards it is aimed to bring down the socialist system in the DPRK.
					
					 He continued: The U.S. will remain unchanged in its aggressive scenario to increase its political and military influence through military intervention in sovereign states. 
					
					 The DPRK will smash the moves of the U.S. and its allies to stifle it and defend socialism to the last. 
					
					 All the progressive political parties, organizations and personages of Italy extend full support and solidarity to the Korean people in their struggle.

articles.title: DPRK Praised by Brazilian Body
articles.content:
DPRK Praised by Brazilian Body
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- The Brazilian Committee for Solidarity with the DPRK on May 13 posted an article "Strength of Korea" on its internet website illustrated with a photo of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un inspecting a unit of the Korean People's Army (KPA). 
					 The DPRK is not a big country in territory and population but it is so strong that no one dares provoke it, the article said, and went on:
					
					 The DPRK's might lies in that it is led by an outstanding leader. 
					
					 The leader's warmest love for the people is the factor that has placed the single-minded unity, the primary aspect of the national power of the DPRK, on the highest level. 
					
					 The single-minded unity of the DPRK which was provided by President Kim Il Sung and consolidated by General Secretary Kim Jong Il has now reached a higher level thanks to supreme leader Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 The noble personality of Supreme Commander of the KPA Kim Jong Un moves all people, the article noted. 
					
					 It recalled he has inspected KPA units to take care of service personnel as their real father would do.
					
					 The Songun leadership of Kim Jong Un helps bolster up the military capability of the DPRK to be invincible, the article noted, and continued: 
					
					 The patriotic will of Kim Jong Un makes the DPRK tower high as a socialist thriving nation. 
					
					 Its core and basic technology and technical engineering in major fields are making rapid progress and its satellite manufacturing and launching technology and nuclear technology have reached a high level.

articles.title: DPRK's Strong Stand Praised by Egyptian Figure
articles.content:
DPRK's Strong Stand Praised by Egyptian Figure
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- Yehia Zakaria Khairullah, vice chairman of the Socialist Freedom Party of Egypt, carried a commentary titled "DPRK raises a banner of resistance" on the May 2 issue of the paper Sautl Balad.
					 The paper said:
					
					 The DPRK successfully launched a satellite in December last year according to a peaceful plan for developing science and technology to benefit humankind and contribute to economic construction of the country and the improvement of the people's living standard, and conducted a nuclear test in February this year.
					
					 World space experts recognized the success made by the DPRK in the field of space.
					
					 But the U.S. instigated the UN Security Council to cook up a "resolution on sanctions" against the DPRK.
					
					 This was an overt infringement on the DPRK's sovereignty.
					
					 Laying bare the U.S. nuclear moves against Pyongyang with historical facts, the paper went on:
					
					 Pyongyang was compelled to change its policy to confront the UNSC "resolution on sanctions" and the U.S. hostile policy toward it.
					
					 The third underground nuclear test conducted by the DPRK was an expression of its surging resentment against the U.S. double standards.
					
					 The nuclear test does not fall foul of international law.
					
					 The U.S. has threatened Pyongyang with nuclear weapons for more than half a century and cried out for a preemptive nuclear attack even in the new century. It is, indeed, the very one who compelled the DPRK to possess nukes.
					
					 If the U.S. keeps escalating the situation on the Korean Peninsula, the DPRK will take stronger measures to cope with it.

articles.title: WPK's New Line Supported by German Organization
articles.content:
WPK's New Line Supported by German Organization
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- The Franken Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of Germany issued a statement on May 15 in support of the line of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) on simultaneously pushing forward economic construction and the building of nuclear force.
					 The WPK's is the wisest line which helps firmly defend the sovereignty of the country and the dignity of the nation from the U.S. escalating hostile moves against the DPRK and dynamically step up the building of a thriving nation, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 The U.S. has escalated the war maneuvers against the DPRK and deteriorated the situation on the Korean Peninsula, threatening the peace in Northeast Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					 It is the requirement of the prevailing situation that the Korean people push forward economic construction while steadily increasing the capabilities for self-defence with main emphasis on nuclear force.
					
					 We wish the Korean people bigger successes in building a thriving nation by adhering to the WPK's line.

articles.title: Enviado especial de Kim Jong Un parte de Pyongyang hacia RPCh
articles.content:
Enviado especial de Kim Jong Un parte de Pyongyang hacia RPCh
Pyongyang, 22 de mayo (ACNC) -- Como enviado especial del Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, el vicemariscal del Ejercito Popular de Corea Choe Ryong Hae, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del PTC y jefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC, partio el dia 22 de esta capital por avion especial para cumplir una visita a la Republica Popular China.
					Entre sus acompanantes figuran el coronel general del EPC, Ri Yong Gil, el subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Kim Song Nam, el viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores, Kim Hyong Jun, el teniente general del EPC, Kim Su Gil, y otros funcionarios. 
					
					Ellos fueron despedidos en la terminal aerea por el jefe del Estado Mayor General del EPC, Kim Kyok Sik, el secretario del CC del PTC, Kim Yong Il, el coronel general del EPC, Son Chol Ju, el subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Ri Yong Chol, el viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores, Pak Kil Yon, y otros funcionarios, asi como el embajador chino en Corea, Liu Hongcai.

articles.title: Enviado especial de Kim Jong Un arriba a Beijing
articles.content:
Enviado especial de Kim Jong Un arriba a Beijing
Pyongyang, 22 de mayo (ACNC) -- El vicemariscal del Ejercito Popular de Corea Choe Ryong Hae, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y jefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC, llego el dia 22 por avion especial a Beijing para cumplir una visita a la Republica Popular China en calidad de enviado especial del Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					Le acompanan el coronel general del EPC, Ri Yong Gil, el subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Kim Song Nam, el viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores, Kim Hyong Jun, el teniente general del EPC, Kim Su Gil, y otros funcionarios. 
					
					Los visitantes fueron acogidos en el aeropuerto por el subjefe del Departamento de Enlace Internacional del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de China, Liu Jieyi, y otros funcionarios chinos y el embajador coreano en China, Ji Jae Ryong.
